paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: LQT2 phenotype with prolonged action potentials
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In myocytes carrying an LQT2 mutation (HERG-A422T), APs and [Ca2+]i transients were prolonged in parallel.

individual_records.phenotype_details: LQT2 phenotype with prolonged action potentials
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In myocytes carrying an LQT2 mutation (HERG-A422T), APs and [Ca2+]i transients were prolonged in parallel.

functional_data.summary: The HERG-A422T mutation produces trafficking-defective HERG K+ channels that decrease the rapidly activating delayed rectifier current (IKr).

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in the studied patients.
variants.additional_notes: The study utilized patient-derived induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) to model the LQT2 phenotype.
key_quotes: In myocytes carrying an LQT2 mutation (HERG-A422T), APs and [Ca2+]i transients were prolonged in parallel.
The IKr density was about 50% of control, consistent with the observed AP prolongation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 gene variant was extracted successfully.
